title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Bridão Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: The heavy bottle is probably a good proportion of the price of this wine—an unnecessary affectation. The wine itself is firm and structured, perfumed with typical Touriga Nacional violet aromas and rich. With its dense texture and juicy black plum fruits, it is still coming together, so don't drink before 2017.

title: Barista 2013 Pinotage (Western Cape)
description: This is an incredibly modern style of Pinotage, boasting forward notes of mocha, raspberry sauce, muddled black cherry and vanilla cream on the nose and mouth. The palate is rich and creamy, with plush fruit flavors and a soft, jammy texture. Drink now.

title: Chillhouse 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dense and concentrated strawberries mix with black rocks and gravel on the nose of this stylishly labeled bottle. The palate is somewhat sweet with blueberry and blackberry jam flavors, as well as earthy notes.

title: Cormòns 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Delicate scents of white flower and stone fruit emerge on this brisk white. The slender, racy palate shows grapefruit, citrus zest, slate and a note of crushed herb.

title: David Frost 2014 Pinotage (Western Cape)
description: Wild berry and cherry aromas and flavors are at the center of this jammy, fruit-forward wine. It's balanced and accessible, with soft tannins and medium acidity that lend a freshness to the finish. Drink now.

title: Dürer-Weg 2014 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: This opens with scents of orchard fruit, citrus and a touch of stone. The aromas float over to the light-bodied, straightforward palate along with a hint of citrus. Bracing acidity gives it a racy finish.

title: Domaine du Vieux Vauvert 2014  Vouvray
description: This medium-dry wine is fresh, crisp and fruity with ripe, creamy apples, honey and fine acidity. It is well balanced, the sweetness just giving the fruit a lift while keeping all its freshness.

title: Miro 2013 Orsi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a richness that borders on candied, a celebration of ripe raspberry and cherry with medium weight and body around strong streaks of tannin.

title: Mr. Riggs 2014 Generation Series Mrs. Viognier (McLaren Vale)
description: Not as varietally expressive as the 2013, this is nonetheless a solid, well-made white wine. A hint of gingery spice frames yellow plum fruit, which then comes to a dry, dusty close on the finish.

title: Kössler 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: This straightforward, refreshing white opens with light scents of Spanish broom and a whiff of crushed stone. The palate is on the lean side, showing crisp apple, pear and a hint of mineral alongside brisk acidity.

title: Jip Jip Rocks 2013 Shiraz (Padthaway)
description: This is full bodied and supple, with attractive red-berry fruit, but also displays a slightly acrid, smoky note. Decant vigorously for best results.

title: Paro 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Big, sweetened tannins reminiscent of tobacco and leather pouch sit atop cedar, herb and vanilla. The fruit is both red and black, true to the vineyard and this area of the Russian River.

title: Passaggio 2014 Hook VIneyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Touches of cinnamon, turned earth, iron, dark cranberry and fresh raspberry hit the nose on this bottling from a celebrated vineyard. The palate shows lots of potential with more bottle age, offering notes of graphite, underripe berries, black pepper and bay leaf.

title: Huguet de Can Feixes 2014 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)
description: Aromas of peach pit are neutral except for some oily notes. This multigrape blend feels plump, oily and propped up by solid acidity. Pithy flavors of grapefruit and melon are slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien Viognier (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Docile aromas of apricot and peach linger under an oaky blanket of toasted coconut praline. Full and silky on the palate, the fruit tones remain quiet, taking on a lightly brûléed character. Texture wins over flavor intensity in this Viognier that has seen 18 months in French oak.
designation: Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Malbec (Rogue Valley)
description: Very little differentiates this from the winery's other single-varietal reds. They all seem like components rather than complete wines. It's dry and austere, with barely ripe red berry fruit. The hard, short finish and drying tannins make this wine difficult to like.

title: Pflücken 2014 Sweet Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle hints of cereal and grain permeate throughout this medium-sweet Riesling, lending a savory tone to honeyed grapefruit and apple flavors. While lacking great refinement, it offers fruit-forward refreshment for casual settings. Drink now.

title: MAN Family Wines 2014 Ou Kalant Cabernet Sauvignon (Coastal Region)
description: This is a perfect everyday wine, with immediately attractive notes of Thin Mint, mocha, black raspberry, brambly boysenberry and cassis that abound on the nose and mouth. Touches of purple flowers and cocoa powder add decadence, while soft tannins lend an approachable structure to the palate. Drink now.

title: Gigante 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Scents of yellow flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The tangy, straightforward palate offers citrus and peach framed in zesty acidity.

title: Livio Felluga 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This opens with hushed aromas that recall pressed white flower and orchard fruit. The rather lean palate shows raw yellow peach and a touch of acacia honey alongside bracing acidity. A note of bitter almond and a hint of mineral mark the finish.

title: La Rajade 2014 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This white starts by presenting aromas of orchard fruit, pressed yellow flower and toasted almond. The bright palate offers white peach and crisp pear alongside the bracing acidity that characterizes this vintage.

title: Recanati 2012 Reserve Manara Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)
description: Deep black cherry in the glass, this wine has a fruit-forward nose of raspberry and watermelon. Flavors of tart cherry and cranberry are quickly overcome by tannins that are a little too stiff for their own good.

title: Shooting Star 2012 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This tasty wine has vivid cherry, strawberry, candylike aromas and flavors. Medium bodied, it offers a mouthfeel that's almost syrupy, a balance that's slightly sweet and an easy-drinking texture.

title: Sol Rouge 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Primarily sourced from vineyards on Howell Mountain and within Napa Valley's Glass Mountain area, this wine aims to take its cues from Bordeaux, according to the producer. It's soft and revelatory in cinnamon and black-pepper spiciness, with black currant on the palate. It finishes in chewing tobacco and tar.

title: C.H. Berres 2013 Impulse Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle spice and mineral notes accent flavors of pressed apple, lemon and pear in this off-dry Riesling. It's an uncomplicated but refreshing wine marked by sharp lemon-lime acidity and a crisp, clean finish. Drink now.

title: Bowers Harbor 2014 Medium Sweet Riesling (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Quite quinine and focused on the nose, underripe peach tones linger underneath. The well-balanced palate plays between juicy peach and shocks of lime, leading to a talc-dusted finish.

title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Tinto Red (Alentejo)
description: This soft, ripe and fruity blend of local grapes is young and spicy. It has flavors of ripe red fruits that are cut with juicy acidity. It's a fresh wine that is ready to drink.

title: Coruce 2013 Chardonnay (Antelope Valley of the California High Desert)
description: From 2,800 feet in one of the newer American appellations, this high-desert bottling offers plush and ripe lemon cream, pineapple and guava notes on the nose, with a slight chamomile complexity in the background. The flavors are intriguing, with Rainbow Stripe bubblegum, cotton candy and apple-strudel elements.
region_1: Antelope Valley of the California High Desert

title: Castel Sallegg 2014 Prey Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate apple, mineral and a hint of toasted almond aromas carry over to the simple, straightforward palate along with a note of beeswax and citrus. Racy acidity provides balance and freshness.

title: Castle Rock 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Punchy hibiscus and pomegranate notes mix with crushed black rocks and rose petals on the nose of this very reliable every-day drinker. The palate is earthy and herbal in character, with flavors of bay leaf, camphor, dried mint, pine sap and tangy cranberry juice making it very food-friendly.
